…President Franklin D. Roosevelt  across the Atlantic Ocean for the Tehran Conference with Winston  Churchill and Joseph Stalin in November 1943. It was also on the USS  Iowa in Tokyo Bay, where Johnson would watch the Japanese sign the  Instrument of Surrender on the USS Missouri.

After the war, Johnson returned home to Waltham and married Ruth  Hills.…

…Europe, Mr. Stevens continued his service, which concluded  in 1945 in the Pacific theater, where he personally witnessed the  signing of the Japanese Instrument of Surrender in Tokyo Harbor,  bringing World War II to its official end.

…Speaker, I rise today to recognize and congratulate the  outstanding USA Men's Deaf Basketball team that recently earned the  gold medal while competing at the 2025 Deaflympics in Tokyo.

The team bested every other competing country, culminating in an  electrifying 69-59 victory over Ukraine in the finals.
